para.p:
If
μ

ν

=

.

To prove that

B
in
R n

=
⁢ μ
( B )
⁢ ν
( B )

ϕ n

⁢
C c

(
R n
)

χ B
pointwise. On the one hand, by the dominated convergence theorem,
→
⟨
ϕ n
, μ ⟩
⁢ μ
( B )
and
→
⟨
ϕ n

⁢ ν
( B )
as
→ n ∞

para.p:

para.p: called a Gaussian measure.

Math.text: formulae@(hat@(mu) * xi = exponential@(- (((1 / 2) * xi) cdot Lambda ^ (- 1)) * xi), xi element-of R ^ n)

para.p: We have

Math.text: hat@(mu) * xi = (integral _ (R ^ n))@(e ^ (- (i * xi) cdot x) * square-root@(determinant@(Lambda)) * exponential@(- (((1 / 2) * x) cdot Lambda) * x) * differential-d@(m _ n) * x) = (integral _ (R ^ d))@(e ^ (- i * xi _ 1 * x _ 1 - cdots - i * xi _ n * x _ n) * square-root@(lambda _ 1 * cdots * lambda _ n) * exponential@(- (1 / 2) * lambda _ 1 * (x _ 1) ^ 2 - cdots - (1 / 2) * lambda _ n * (x _ n) ^ 2) * differential-d@(m _ n) * x) = ((product _ (j = 1)) ^ n)@(I _ j)
hat@(mu) * xi
(integral _ (R ^ n))@(e ^ (- (i * xi) cdot x) * square-root@(determinant@(Lambda)) * exponential@(- (((1 / 2) * x) cdot Lambda) * x) * differential-d@(m _ n) * x)

(integral _ (R ^ d))@(e ^ (- i * xi _ 1 * x _ 1 - cdots - i * xi _ n * x _ n) * square-root@(lambda _ 1 * cdots * lambda _ n) * exponential@(- (1 / 2) * lambda _ 1 * (x _ 1) ^ 2 - cdots - (1 / 2) * lambda _ n * (x _ n) ^ 2) * differential-d@(m _ n) * x)
((product _ (j = 1)) ^ n)@(I _ j)

para.p: where

Math.text: I _ j = (integral _ R)@(e ^ (- i * xi _ j * x _ j) * square-root@(lambda _ j) * exponential@(- (1 / 2) * lambda _ j * (x _ j) ^ 2) * differential-d@(m _ 1) * x _ j)

para.p: Using

Math.text: - i * xi _ j * x _ j - (1 / 2) * lambda _ j * (x _ j) ^ 2 = - (lambda _ j / 2) * ((x _ j + (i * xi _ j) / lambda _ j) ^ 2 + (xi _ j) ^ 2 / (lambda _ j) ^ 2) = - (lambda _ j / 2) * (x _ j + (i * xi _ j) / lambda _ j) ^ 2 - (xi _ j) ^ 2 / (2 * lambda _ j)

para.p: we get, doing contour integration,

Math.text: I _ j = (integral _ R)@(square-root@(lambda _ j) * exponential@(- (lambda _ j / 2) * (x _ j + (i * xi _ j) / lambda _ j) ^ 2) * exponential@(- (xi _ j) ^ 2 / (2 * lambda _ j)) * differential-d@(m _ 1) * x _ j) = (integral _ R)@(square-root@(lambda _ j) * exponential@(- (lambda _ j * (x _ j) ^ 2) / 2) * exponential@(- (xi _ j) ^ 2 / (2 * lambda _ j)) * differential-d@(m _ 1) * x _ j) = (integral _ R)@(square-root@(lambda _ j) * exponential@(- (y _ j) ^ 2) * exponential@(- (xi _ j) ^ 2 / (2 * lambda _ j)) * square-root@(2 / lambda _ j) * differential-d@(m _ 1) * y _ j) = exponential@(- (xi _ j) ^ 2 / (2 * lambda _ j)) * (integral _ R)@(square-root@(2) * exponential@(- (y _ j) ^ 2) * differential-d@(m _ 1) * y _ j) = exponential@(- (xi _ j) ^ 2 / (2 * lambda _ j)) * (integral _ R)@((1 / square-root@(pi)) * exponential@(- (y _ j) ^ 2) * differential-d@(y _ j)) = exponential@(- (xi _ j) ^ 2 / (2 * lambda _ j))
I _ j

(integral _ R)@(square-root@(lambda _ j) * exponential@(- (lambda _ j / 2) * (x _ j + (i * xi _ j) / lambda _ j) ^ 2) * exponential@(- (xi _ j) ^ 2 / (2 * lambda _ j)) * differential-d@(m _ 1) * x _ j)
(integral _ R)@(square-root@(lambda _ j) * exponential@(- (lambda _ j * (x _ j) ^ 2) / 2) * exponential@(- (xi _ j) ^ 2 / (2 * lambda _ j)) * differential-d@(m _ 1) * x _ j)
(integral _ R)@(square-root@(lambda _ j) * exponential@(- (y _ j) ^ 2) * exponential@(- (xi _ j) ^ 2 / (2 * lambda _ j)) * square-root@(2 / lambda _ j) * differential-d@(m _ 1) * y _ j)
exponential@(- (xi _ j) ^ 2 / (2 * lambda _ j)) * (integral _ R)@(square-root@(2) * exponential@(- (y _ j) ^ 2) * differential-d@(m _ 1) * y _ j)
exponential@(- (xi _ j) ^ 2 / (2 * lambda _ j)) * (integral _ R)@((1 / square-root@(pi)) * exponential@(- (y _ j) ^ 2) * differential-d@(y _ j))
exponential@(- (xi _ j) ^ 2 / (2 * lambda _ j))

h

h

Math.tex: \displaystyle(T_{-h}x)\cdot(\Lambda T_{-h}x)=(x+h)\cdot(\Lambda(x+h))=(x+h)% \cdot(\Lambda x+\Lambda h)=x\cdot\Lambda x+x\cdot\Lambda h+h\cdot\Lambda x+h% \cdot\Lambda h=x\cdot\Lambda x+2x\cdot\Lambda h+h\cdot\Lambda h.
Math.text: (T _ (- h) * x) cdot (Lambda * T _ (- h) * x) = (x + h) cdot (Lambda * (x + h)) = (x + h) cdot (Lambda * x + Lambda * h) = (x cdot Lambda) * x + (x cdot Lambda) * h + (h cdot Lambda) * x + (h cdot Lambda) * h = (x cdot Lambda) * x + ((2 * x) cdot Lambda) * h + (h cdot Lambda) * h

(x cdot Lambda) * x + ((2 * x) cdot Lambda) * h + (h cdot Lambda) * h

is not a Banach space or even a Fréchet space, and thus does not have a robust structure itself, but is used because it is easier to prove things for it which one then extends in some way to spaces in which the set is dense. The proof of the following theorem follows Folland. 2 2 footnote 2 Gerald B. Folland, A Course in Abstract Harmonic Analysis, p. 85, Proposition 3.35.

⁢

Math.text: R = (sum _ (list@(i, j)))@((integral _ (E _ i * E _ j))@((F * open-interval@(x, y) - F * open-interval@(x _ i, x _ j)) * differential-d@(m _ n) * x * differential-d@(m _ n) * y))

R

Math.text: (integral _ (K * K))@(F * open-interval@(x, y) * differential-d@(m _ n) * x * differential-d@(m _ n) * y) >= - absolute-value@(R) >= - epsilon * m _ n * K ^ 2

para.p:
This is true for all
> ϵ 0
, hence
